availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Magoffin County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Ann Marshall Risner. Father of Dial Risner, Bethany Risner, Delany Risner, Miles Risner, Marshall Risner, James Risner, Gardner Risner, Isaac Risner, and John Risner. Farmer in Floyd County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Magoffin County, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Floyd County, p. 448B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Magoffin County, p. 427.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 5691.
"Jacob 'Jake' Risner (1815-1903)," Find A Grave, Memorial 91853243, accessed November 9, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/91853243.
